title: Assyrian people
summary: Assyrians (ܣܘܪ̈ܝܐ, Sūrāyē/Sūrōyē) are an ethnic group indigenous to the Middle East.[Note 2] Some self-identify as Syriacs,[Note 3] Chaldeans,[Note 4] or Arameans.[Note 5] They are speakers of the Neo-Aramaic branch of Semitic languages as well as the primary languages in their countries of residence.[59] Modern Assyrians are Syriac Christians who claim descent from Assyria, one of the oldest civilizations in the world, dating back to 2500 BC in ancient Mesopotamia.[60]
